Legal_Issue: Classification of a 'particular social group' under section 96 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 96
Evidence_Assessment: Perceived affiliation with LTTE due to travel on MV Sun Sea
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate well-founded fear of persecution
Credibility_Factor: Association with MV Sun Sea voyage
Legal_Rule: Definition of 'particular social group' must be tied to human rights and anti-discrimination principles
Procedural_Issue: Misapplication of legal standard by RPD
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on perceived LTTE affiliation
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RPD failed to apply correct legal framework
Key_Evidence_Considered: Travel on MV Sun Sea, Tamil male identity, context of Sri Lankan civil conflict
Legal_Framework: International refugee law, Canadian immigration law
Applicant_Challenge: RPD incorrectly classified group as 'particular social group'
Legal_Rule_Source: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 96
Outcome: Decision set aside and remitted to new RPD panel
Legal_Provision: Section 96, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Claimant_Status: Sri Lankan Tamil citizen claiming refugee status
Applicable_Process: Refugee protection division hearing, judicial review
Governing_Rule: Interpretation of 'particular social group' under section 96
